levels.task:
Type Selector

Selects all elements of type A. Type refers to the type of tag, so div, p and ul are all different element types.

Example:

div selects all div elements.

Descendant Selector

Select an element of type A inside another element of type B.

Example:

p span selects all span elements that are inside of any p

Class Selector

Select elements by their class A. The class selector selects all elements with that class attribute. Elements can have many classes.

Example:

.aple selects all elements with class='aple'

levels.taskHeader: Select the dancing bread whith cheese
levels.task:
ID Selector

Select elements with an ID

Example:

#aple selects all elements with id='aple'
levels.html: <plate class='black' title='plate'><bread title='bread'><ham title='ham'></ham></bread></plate><plate title='plate'><bread class='strobe' title='bread'><cheese title='cheese'></cheese></bread></plate>

levels.taskHeader: Select the dancing cheese and tomato
levels.task:
Comma

Select multiple elements using comma

Example:

div, p selects all div elements as well as all elements p
levels.html: <plate class='black' title='plate'><bread title='bread'><cheese  class='strobe' title='cheese'></cheese></bread></plate><plate class='black' title='plate'><bread title='bread'><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></tomato></bread></plate>

levels.taskHeader: Select the bread whith cheese, black plate and tomato
levels.task:
Comma Combination

Select elements with their ID, class, tag using commas

Example:

#aple, .red, div you can combine diferent selectors with comma
levels.html: <plate class='black strobe' title='plate'><bread title='bread'><ham title='ham'></ham></bread></plate><plate title='plate'><bread class='strobe' title='bread'><cheese title='cheese'></bread></plate><plate title='plate'><bread title='bread'><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></tomato></bread></plate>

levels.task:
Universal Selector

Select all elements you have

Example:

* selects all elements'
levels.html: <plate class='strobe' title='plate'><bread title='bread'></ham></bread></plate><plate class='black strobe' title='plate'><bread title='bread'><cheese title='cheese'></bread></plate><plate class='strobe' title='plate'><tomato title='tomato'></tomato></plate>

levels.task:
Universal Selector Combination

Select all elements inside of A

Example:

div * selects all elements inside of div
levels.html: <plate title='plate'><bread title='bread'><cheese class='strobe title='cheese'' title='cheese'><cheese><tomato title='tomato'></tomato></bread></plate><plate title='plate'><bread title='bread'><ham class='strobe' title='ham'></ham></bread></plate><plate class='black' title='plate'><tomato title='tomato'></tomato></plate>

levels.taskHeader: Select tomatos directly on a plate
levels.task:
Child Selector

unlike whitespace, selects only those elements that are directly children of the specified element.

Example:

A > B selects all B that are a direct children A
levels.html: <plate class='black' title='plate'><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></plate><plate title='plate'><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></tomato></plate><tomato title='tomato'></tomato>

levels.taskHeader: Select tomatos directly NOT on a plate
levels.task:
General Sibling Selector

Selects elements that are at the same nesting level, after the specified element, with the same parent.

Example:

p ~ span will select all elements that are after the

element within the same parent.
levels.html: <plate title='plate'><tomato title='tomato'></tomato></plate><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></tomato><tomato class='strobe' title='tomato'></tomato>
